00056 static int mult = 20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00057 static int enc_pool_max_memory_mb;
00058 module_param(enc_pool_max_memory_mb, int, 0644);
00059 MODULE_PARM_DESC(enc_pool_max_memory_mb,
00060                  "Encoding pool max memory (MB), 1/8 of total physical memory by default");
00061 
00062 /****************************************
00063  * bulk encryption page pools           *
00064  ****************************************/
00065 
00066 
00067 #define PTRS_PER_PAGE   (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE / sizeof(void *))
00068 #define PAGES_PER_POOL  (PTRS_PER_PAGE)
00069 
00070 #define IDLE_IDX_MAX            (100)
00071 #define IDLE_IDX_WEIGHT         (3)
00072 
00073 #define CACHE_QUIESCENT_PERIOD  (20)
00074 
00075 static struct ptlrpc_enc_page_pool {
00076         /*
00077          * constants
00078          */
00079         unsigned long    epp_max_pages;   /* maximum pages can hold, const */
00080         unsigned int     epp_max_pools;   /* number of pools, const */
00081 
00082         /*
00083          * wait queue in case of not enough free pages.
00084          */
00085         wait_queue_head_t    epp_waitq;       /* waiting threads */
00086         unsigned int     epp_waitqlen;    /* wait queue length */
00087         unsigned long    epp_pages_short; /* # of pages wanted of in-q users */
00088         unsigned int     epp_growing:1;   /* during adding pages */
00089 
00090         /*
00091          * indicating how idle the pools are, from 0 to MAX_IDLE_IDX
00092          * this is counted based on each time when getting pages from
00093          * the pools, not based on time. which means in case that system
00094          * is idled for a while but the idle_idx might still be low if no
00095          * activities happened in the pools.
00096          */
00097         unsigned long    epp_idle_idx;
00098 
00099         /* last shrink time due to mem tight */
00100         long             epp_last_shrink;
00101         long             epp_last_access;
00102 
00103         /*
00104          * in-pool pages bookkeeping
00105          */
00106         spinlock_t       epp_lock;         /* protect following fields */
00107         unsigned long    epp_total_pages; /* total pages in pools */
00108         unsigned long    epp_free_pages;  /* current pages available */
00109 
00110         /*
00111          * statistics
00112          */
00113         unsigned long    epp_st_max_pages;      /* # of pages ever reached */
00114         unsigned int     epp_st_grows;          /* # of grows */
00115         unsigned int     epp_st_grow_fails;     /* # of add pages failures */
00116         unsigned int     epp_st_shrinks;        /* # of shrinks */
00117         unsigned long    epp_st_access;         /* # of access */
00118         unsigned long    epp_st_missings;       /* # of cache missing */
00119         unsigned long    epp_st_lowfree;        /* lowest free pages reached */
00120         unsigned int     epp_st_max_wqlen;      /* highest waitqueue length */
00121         cfs_time_t       epp_st_max_wait;       /* in jeffies */
00122         unsigned long    epp_st_outofmem;       /* # of out of mem requests */
00123         /*
00124          * pointers to pools, may be vmalloc'd
00125          */
00126         struct page    ***epp_pools;
00127 } page_pools;
00128 
00129 /*
00130  * memory shrinker
00131  */
00132 static const int pools_shrinker_seeks = DEFAULT_SEEKS;
00133 static struct shrinker *pools_shrinker;
00134

00136 /*
00137  * /proc/fs/lustre/sptlrpc/encrypt_page_pools
00138  */
00139 int sptlrpc_proc_enc_pool_seq_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
00140 {
00141         spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00142 
00143         seq_printf(m, "physical pages:          %lu\n"
00144                    "pages per pool:          %lu\n"
00145                    "max pages:               %lu\n"
00146                    "max pools:               %u\n"
00147                    "total pages:             %lu\n"
00148                    "total free:              %lu\n"
00149                    "idle index:              %lu/100\n"
00150                    "last shrink:             %lds\n"
00151                    "last access:             %lds\n"
00152                    "max pages reached:       %lu\n"
00153                    "grows:                   %u\n"
00154                    "grows failure:           %u\n"
00155                    "shrinks:                 %u\n"
00156                    "cache access:            %lu\n"
00157                    "cache missing:           %lu\n"
00158                    "low free mark:           %lu\n"
00159                    "max waitqueue depth:     %u\n"
00160                    "max wait time:           "CFS_TIME_T"/%lu\n"
00161                    "out of mem:             %lu\n",
00162                    totalram_pages, PAGES_PER_POOL,
00163                    page_pools.epp_max_pages,
00164                    page_pools.epp_max_pools,
00165                    page_pools.epp_total_pages,
00166                    page_pools.epp_free_pages,
00167                    page_pools.epp_idle_idx,
00168                    cfs_time_current_sec() - page_pools.epp_last_shrink,
00169                    cfs_time_current_sec() - page_pools.epp_last_access,
00170                    page_pools.epp_st_max_pages,
00171                    page_pools.epp_st_grows,
00172                    page_pools.epp_st_grow_fails,
00173                    page_pools.epp_st_shrinks,
00174                    page_pools.epp_st_access,
00175                    page_pools.epp_st_missings,
00176                    page_pools.epp_st_lowfree,
00177                    page_pools.epp_st_max_wqlen,
00178                    page_pools.epp_st_max_wait,
00179                    msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC),
00180                    page_pools.epp_st_outofmem);
00181 
00182         spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00183         return 0;
00184 }
00185 
00186 static void enc_pools_release_free_pages(long npages)
00187 {
00188         int     p_idx, g_idx;
00189         int     p_idx_max1, p_idx_max2;
00190 
00191         LASSERT(npages > 0);
00192         LASSERT(npages <= page_pools.epp_free_pages);
00193         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_free_pages <= page_pools.epp_total_pages);
00194 
00195         /* max pool index before the release */
00196         p_idx_max2 = (page_pools.epp_total_pages - 1) / PAGES_PER_POOL;
00197 
00198         page_pools.epp_free_pages -= npages;
00199         page_pools.epp_total_pages -= npages;
00200 
00201         /* max pool index after the release */
00202         p_idx_max1 = page_pools.epp_total_pages == 0 ? -1 :
00203                      ((page_pools.epp_total_pages - 1) / PAGES_PER_POOL);
00204 
00205         p_idx = page_pools.epp_free_pages / PAGES_PER_POOL;
00206         g_idx = page_pools.epp_free_pages % PAGES_PER_POOL;
00207         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx]);
00208 
00209         while (npages--) {
00210                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx]);
00211                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx][g_idx] != NULL);
00212 
00213                 __free_page(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx][g_idx]);
00214                 page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx][g_idx] = NULL;
00215 
00216                 if (++g_idx == PAGES_PER_POOL) {
00217                         p_idx++;
00218                         g_idx = 0;
00219                 }
00220         }
00221 
00222         /* free unused pools */
00223         while (p_idx_max1 < p_idx_max2) {
00224                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx_max2]);
00225                 OBD_FREE(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx_max2], PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00226                 page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx_max2] = NULL;
00227                 p_idx_max2--;
00228         }
00229 }
00230 
00231 /*
00232  * we try to keep at least PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES pages in the pool.
00233  */
00234 static unsigned long enc_pools_shrink_count(struct shrinker *s,
00235                                             struct shrink_control *sc)
00236 {
00237         /*
00238          * if no pool access for a long time, we consider it's fully idle.
00239          * a little race here is fine.
00240          */
00241         if (unlikely(cfs_time_current_sec() - page_pools.epp_last_access >
00242                      CACHE_QUIESCENT_PERIOD)) {
00243                 spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00244                 page_pools.epp_idle_idx = IDLE_IDX_MAX;
00245                 spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00246         }
00247 
00248         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_idle_idx <= IDLE_IDX_MAX);
00249         return max((int)page_pools.epp_free_pages - PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES, 0) *
00250                 (IDLE_IDX_MAX - page_pools.epp_idle_idx) / IDLE_IDX_MAX;
00251 }
00252 
00253 /*
00254  * we try to keep at least PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES pages in the pool.
00255  */
00256 static unsigned long enc_pools_shrink_scan(struct shrinker *s,
00257                                            struct shrink_control *sc)
00258 {
00259         spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00260         sc->nr_to_scan = min_t(unsigned long, sc->nr_to_scan,
00261                               page_pools.epp_free_pages - PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES);
00262         if (sc->nr_to_scan > 0) {
00263                 enc_pools_release_free_pages(sc->nr_to_scan);
00264                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "released %ld pages, %ld left\n",
00265                        (long)sc->nr_to_scan, page_pools.epp_free_pages);
00266 
00267                 page_pools.epp_st_shrinks++;
00268                 page_pools.epp_last_shrink = cfs_time_current_sec();
00269         }
00270         spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00271 
00272         /*
00273          * if no pool access for a long time, we consider it's fully idle.
00274          * a little race here is fine.
00275          */
00276         if (unlikely(cfs_time_current_sec() - page_pools.epp_last_access >
00277                      CACHE_QUIESCENT_PERIOD)) {
00278                 spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00279                 page_pools.epp_idle_idx = IDLE_IDX_MAX;
00280                 spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00281         }
00282 
00283         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_idle_idx <= IDLE_IDX_MAX);
00284         return sc->nr_to_scan;
00285 }
00286 
00287 #ifndef HAVE_SHRINKER_COUNT
00288 /*
00289  * could be called frequently for query (@nr_to_scan == 0).
00290  * we try to keep at least PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES pages in the pool.
00291  */
00292 static int enc_pools_shrink(SHRINKER_ARGS(sc, nr_to_scan, gfp_mask))
00293 {
00294         struct shrink_control scv = {
00295                 .nr_to_scan = shrink_param(sc, nr_to_scan),
00296                 .gfp_mask   = shrink_param(sc, gfp_mask)
00297         };
00298 #if !defined(HAVE_SHRINKER_WANT_SHRINK_PTR) && !defined(HAVE_SHRINK_CONTROL)
00299         struct shrinker* shrinker = NULL;
00300 #endif
00301 
00302         enc_pools_shrink_scan(shrinker, &scv);
00303 
00304         return enc_pools_shrink_count(shrinker, &scv);
00305 }
00306 
00307 #endif /* HAVE_SHRINKER_COUNT */
00308 
00309 static inline
00310 int npages_to_npools(unsigned long npages)
00311 {
00312         return (int) ((npages + PAGES_PER_POOL - 1) / PAGES_PER_POOL);
00313 }
00314 
00315 /*
00316  * return how many pages cleaned up.
00317  */
00318 static unsigned long enc_pools_cleanup(struct page ***pools, int npools)
00319 {
00320         unsigned long cleaned = 0;
00321         int           i, j;
00322 
00323         for (i = 0; i < npools; i++) {
00324                 if (pools[i]) {
00325                         for (j = 0; j < PAGES_PER_POOL; j++) {
00326                                 if (pools[i][j]) {
00327                                         __free_page(pools[i][j]);
00328                                         cleaned++;
00329                                 }
00330                         }
00331                         OBD_FREE(pools[i], PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00332                         pools[i] = NULL;
00333                 }
00334         }
00335 
00336         return cleaned;
00337 }
00338 
00339 /*
00340  * merge @npools pointed by @pools which contains @npages new pages
00341  * into current pools.
00342  *
00343  * we have options to avoid most memory copy with some tricks. but we choose
00344  * the simplest way to avoid complexity. It's not frequently called.
00345  */
00346 static void enc_pools_insert(struct page ***pools, int npools, int npages)
00347 {
00348         int     freeslot;
00349         int     op_idx, np_idx, og_idx, ng_idx;
00350         int     cur_npools, end_npools;
00351 
00352         LASSERT(npages > 0);
00353         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_total_pages+npages <= page_pools.epp_max_pages);
00354         LASSERT(npages_to_npools(npages) == npools);
00355         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_growing);
00356 
00357         spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00358 
00359         /*
00360          * (1) fill all the free slots of current pools.
00361          */
00362         /* free slots are those left by rent pages, and the extra ones with
00363          * index >= total_pages, locate at the tail of last pool. */
00364         freeslot = page_pools.epp_total_pages % PAGES_PER_POOL;
00365         if (freeslot != 0)
00366                 freeslot = PAGES_PER_POOL - freeslot;
00367         freeslot += page_pools.epp_total_pages - page_pools.epp_free_pages;
00368 
00369         op_idx = page_pools.epp_free_pages / PAGES_PER_POOL;
00370         og_idx = page_pools.epp_free_pages % PAGES_PER_POOL;
00371         np_idx = npools - 1;
00372         ng_idx = (npages - 1) % PAGES_PER_POOL;
00373 
00374         while (freeslot) {
00375                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[op_idx][og_idx] == NULL);
00376                 LASSERT(pools[np_idx][ng_idx] != NULL);
00377 
00378                 page_pools.epp_pools[op_idx][og_idx] = pools[np_idx][ng_idx];
00379                 pools[np_idx][ng_idx] = NULL;
00380 
00381                 freeslot--;
00382 
00383                 if (++og_idx == PAGES_PER_POOL) {
00384                         op_idx++;
00385                         og_idx = 0;
00386                 }
00387                 if (--ng_idx < 0) {
00388                         if (np_idx == 0)
00389                                 break;
00390                         np_idx--;
00391                         ng_idx = PAGES_PER_POOL - 1;
00392                 }
00393         }
00394 
00395         /*
00396          * (2) add pools if needed.
00397          */
00398         cur_npools = (page_pools.epp_total_pages + PAGES_PER_POOL - 1) /
00399                      PAGES_PER_POOL;
00400         end_npools = (page_pools.epp_total_pages + npages + PAGES_PER_POOL -1) /
00401                      PAGES_PER_POOL;
00402         LASSERT(end_npools <= page_pools.epp_max_pools);
00403 
00404         np_idx = 0;
00405         while (cur_npools < end_npools) {
00406                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[cur_npools] == NULL);
00407                 LASSERT(np_idx < npools);
00408                 LASSERT(pools[np_idx] != NULL);
00409 
00410                 page_pools.epp_pools[cur_npools++] = pools[np_idx];
00411                 pools[np_idx++] = NULL;
00412         }
00413 
00414         page_pools.epp_total_pages += npages;
00415         page_pools.epp_free_pages += npages;
00416         page_pools.epp_st_lowfree = page_pools.epp_free_pages;
00417 
00418         if (page_pools.epp_total_pages > page_pools.epp_st_max_pages)
00419                 page_pools.epp_st_max_pages = page_pools.epp_total_pages;
00420 
00421         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "add %d pages to total %lu\n", npages,
00422                page_pools.epp_total_pages);
00423 
00424         spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00425 }
00426 
00427 static int enc_pools_add_pages(int npages)
00428 {
00429         static DEFINE_MUTEX(add_pages_mutex);
00430         struct page   ***pools;
00431         int             npools, alloced = 0;
00432         int             i, j, rc = -ENOMEM;
00433 
00434         if (npages < PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES)
00435                 npages = PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES;
00436 
00437         mutex_lock(&add_pages_mutex);
00438 
00439         if (npages + page_pools.epp_total_pages > page_pools.epp_max_pages)
00440                 npages = page_pools.epp_max_pages - page_pools.epp_total_pages;
00441         LASSERT(npages > 0);
00442 
00443         page_pools.epp_st_grows++;
00444 
00445         npools = npages_to_npools(npages);
00446         OBD_ALLOC(pools, npools * sizeof(*pools));
00447         if (pools == NULL)
00448                 goto out;
00449 
00450         for (i = 0; i < npools; i++) {
00451                 OBD_ALLOC(pools[i], PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00452                 if (pools[i] == NULL)
00453                         goto out_pools;
00454 
00455                 for (j = 0; j < PAGES_PER_POOL && alloced < npages; j++) {
00456                         pools[i][j] = alloc_page(GFP_NOFS |
00457                                                  __GFP_HIGHMEM);
00458                         if (pools[i][j] == NULL)
00459                                 goto out_pools;
00460 
00461                         alloced++;
00462                 }
00463         }
00464         LASSERT(alloced == npages);
00465 
00466         enc_pools_insert(pools, npools, npages);
00467         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "added %d pages into pools\n", npages);
00468         rc = 0;
00469 
00470 out_pools:
00471         enc_pools_cleanup(pools, npools);
00472         OBD_FREE(pools, npools * sizeof(*pools));
00473 out:
00474         if (rc) {
00475                 page_pools.epp_st_grow_fails++;
00476                 CERROR("Failed to allocate %d enc pages\n", npages);
00477         }
00478 
00479         mutex_unlock(&add_pages_mutex);
00480         return rc;
00481 }
00482 
00483 static inline void enc_pools_wakeup(void)
00484 {
00485         assert_spin_locked(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00486 
00487         if (unlikely(page_pools.epp_waitqlen)) {
00488                 LASSERT(waitqueue_active(&page_pools.epp_waitq));
00489                 wake_up_all(&page_pools.epp_waitq);
00490         }
00491 }
00492 
00493 static int enc_pools_should_grow(int page_needed, long now)
00494 {
00495         /* don't grow if someone else is growing the pools right now,
00496          * or the pools has reached its full capacity
00497          */
00498         if (page_pools.epp_growing ||
00499             page_pools.epp_total_pages == page_pools.epp_max_pages)
00500                 return 0;
00501 
00502         /* if total pages is not enough, we need to grow */
00503         if (page_pools.epp_total_pages < page_needed)
00504                 return 1;
00505 
00506         /*
00507          * we wanted to return 0 here if there was a shrink just happened
00508          * moment ago, but this may cause deadlock if both client and ost
00509          * live on single node.
00510          */
00511 #if 0
00512         if (now - page_pools.epp_last_shrink < 2)
00513                 return 0;
00514 #endif
00515 
00516         /*
00517          * here we perhaps need consider other factors like wait queue
00518          * length, idle index, etc. ?
00519          */
00520 
00521         /* grow the pools in any other cases */
00522         return 1;
00523 }
00524 
00525 /*
00526  * Export the number of free pages in the pool
00527  */
00528 int get_free_pages_in_pool(void)
00529 {
00530         return page_pools.epp_free_pages;
00531 }
00532 EXPORT_SYMBOL(get_free_pages_in_pool);
00533 
00534 /*
00535  * Let outside world know if enc_pool full capacity is reached
00536  */
00537 int pool_is_at_full_capacity(void)
00538 {
00539         return (page_pools.epp_total_pages == page_pools.epp_max_pages);
00540 }
00541 EXPORT_SYMBOL(pool_is_at_full_capacity);
00542 
00543 /*
00544  * we allocate the requested pages atomically.
00545  */
00546 int sptlrpc_enc_pool_get_pages(struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc)
00547 {
00548         wait_queue_t  waitlink;
00549         unsigned long   this_idle = -1;
00550         cfs_time_t      tick = 0;
00551         long            now;
00552         int             p_idx, g_idx;
00553         int             i;
00554 
00555         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
00556         LASSERT(desc->bd_iov_count > 0);
00557         LASSERT(desc->bd_iov_count <= page_pools.epp_max_pages);
00558 
00559         /* resent bulk, enc iov might have been allocated previously */
00560         if (GET_ENC_KIOV(desc) != NULL)
00561                 return 0;
00562 
00563         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(GET_ENC_KIOV(desc),
00564                   desc->bd_iov_count * sizeof(*GET_ENC_KIOV(desc)));
00565         if (GET_ENC_KIOV(desc) == NULL)
00566                 return -ENOMEM;
00567 
00568         spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00569 
00570         page_pools.epp_st_access++;
00571 again:
00572         if (unlikely(page_pools.epp_free_pages < desc->bd_iov_count)) {
00573                 if (tick == 0)
00574                         tick = cfs_time_current();
00575 
00576                 now = cfs_time_current_sec();
00577 
00578                 page_pools.epp_st_missings++;
00579                 page_pools.epp_pages_short += desc->bd_iov_count;
00580 
00581                 if (enc_pools_should_grow(desc->bd_iov_count, now)) {
00582                         page_pools.epp_growing = 1;
00583 
00584                         spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00585                         enc_pools_add_pages(page_pools.epp_pages_short / 2);
00586                         spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00587 
00588                         page_pools.epp_growing = 0;
00589 
00590                         enc_pools_wakeup();
00591                 } else {
00592                         if (page_pools.epp_growing) {
00593                                 if (++page_pools.epp_waitqlen >
00594                                     page_pools.epp_st_max_wqlen)
00595                                         page_pools.epp_st_max_wqlen =
00596                                                         page_pools.epp_waitqlen;
00597 
00598                                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00599                                 init_waitqueue_entry(&waitlink, current);
00600                                 add_wait_queue(&page_pools.epp_waitq,
00601                                                &waitlink);
00602 
00603                                 spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00604                                 schedule();
00605                                 remove_wait_queue(&page_pools.epp_waitq,
00606                                                   &waitlink);
00607                                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_waitqlen > 0);
00608                                 spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00609                                 page_pools.epp_waitqlen--;
00610                         } else {
00611                                 /* ptlrpcd thread should not sleep in that case,
00612                                  * or deadlock may occur!
00613                                  * Instead, return -ENOMEM so that upper layers
00614                                  * will put request back in queue. */
00615                                 page_pools.epp_st_outofmem++;
00616                                 spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00617                                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(GET_ENC_KIOV(desc),
00618                                                desc->bd_iov_count *
00619                                                 sizeof(*GET_ENC_KIOV(desc)));
00620                                 GET_ENC_KIOV(desc) = NULL;
00621                                 return -ENOMEM;
00622                         }
00623                 }
00624 
00625                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pages_short >= desc->bd_iov_count);
00626                 page_pools.epp_pages_short -= desc->bd_iov_count;
00627 
00628                 this_idle = 0;
00629                 goto again;
00630         }
00631 
00632         /* record max wait time */
00633         if (unlikely(tick != 0)) {
00634                 tick = cfs_time_current() - tick;
00635                 if (tick > page_pools.epp_st_max_wait)
00636                         page_pools.epp_st_max_wait = tick;
00637         }
00638 
00639         /* proceed with rest of allocation */
00640         page_pools.epp_free_pages -= desc->bd_iov_count;
00641 
00642         p_idx = page_pools.epp_free_pages / PAGES_PER_POOL;
00643         g_idx = page_pools.epp_free_pages % PAGES_PER_POOL;
00644 
00645         for (i = 0; i < desc->bd_iov_count; i++) {
00646                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx][g_idx] != NULL);
00647                 BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page =
00648                        page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx][g_idx];
00649                 page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx][g_idx] = NULL;
00650 
00651                 if (++g_idx == PAGES_PER_POOL) {
00652                         p_idx++;
00653                         g_idx = 0;
00654                 }
00655         }
00656 
00657         if (page_pools.epp_free_pages < page_pools.epp_st_lowfree)
00658                 page_pools.epp_st_lowfree = page_pools.epp_free_pages;
00659 
00660         /*
00661          * new idle index = (old * weight + new) / (weight + 1)
00662          */
00663         if (this_idle == -1) {
00664                 this_idle = page_pools.epp_free_pages * IDLE_IDX_MAX /
00665                             page_pools.epp_total_pages;
00666         }
00667         page_pools.epp_idle_idx = (page_pools.epp_idle_idx * IDLE_IDX_WEIGHT +
00668                                    this_idle) /
00669                                   (IDLE_IDX_WEIGHT + 1);
00670 
00671         page_pools.epp_last_access = cfs_time_current_sec();
00672 
00673         spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00674         return 0;
00675 }
00676 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_enc_pool_get_pages);
00677 
00678 void sptlrpc_enc_pool_put_pages(struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc)
00679 {
00680         int     p_idx, g_idx;
00681         int     i;
00682 
00683         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
00684 
00685         if (GET_ENC_KIOV(desc) == NULL)
00686                 return;
00687 
00688         LASSERT(desc->bd_iov_count > 0);
00689 
00690         spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00691 
00692         p_idx = page_pools.epp_free_pages / PAGES_PER_POOL;
00693         g_idx = page_pools.epp_free_pages % PAGES_PER_POOL;
00694 
00695         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_free_pages + desc->bd_iov_count <=
00696                 page_pools.epp_total_pages);
00697         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx]);
00698 
00699         for (i = 0; i < desc->bd_iov_count; i++) {
00700                 LASSERT(BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page != NULL);
00701                 LASSERT(g_idx != 0 || page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx]);
00702                 LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx][g_idx] == NULL);
00703 
00704                 page_pools.epp_pools[p_idx][g_idx] =
00705                         BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page;
00706 
00707                 if (++g_idx == PAGES_PER_POOL) {
00708                         p_idx++;
00709                         g_idx = 0;
00710                 }
00711         }
00712 
00713         page_pools.epp_free_pages += desc->bd_iov_count;
00714 
00715         enc_pools_wakeup();
00716 
00717         spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00718 
00719         OBD_FREE_LARGE(GET_ENC_KIOV(desc),
00720                  desc->bd_iov_count * sizeof(*GET_ENC_KIOV(desc)));
00721         GET_ENC_KIOV(desc) = NULL;
00722 }
00723 
00724 /*
00725  * we don't do much stuff for add_user/del_user anymore, except adding some
00726  * initial pages in add_user() if current pools are empty, rest would be
00727  * handled by the pools's self-adaption.
00728  */
00729 int sptlrpc_enc_pool_add_user(void)
00730 {
00731         int     need_grow = 0;
00732 
00733         spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00734         if (page_pools.epp_growing == 0 && page_pools.epp_total_pages == 0) {
00735                 page_pools.epp_growing = 1;
00736                 need_grow = 1;
00737         }
00738         spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00739 
00740         if (need_grow) {
00741                 enc_pools_add_pages(PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES +
00742                                     PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES);
00743 
00744                 spin_lock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00745                 page_pools.epp_growing = 0;
00746                 enc_pools_wakeup();
00747                 spin_unlock(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00748         }
00749         return 0;
00750 }
00751 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_enc_pool_add_user);
00752 
00753 int sptlrpc_enc_pool_del_user(void)
00754 {
00755         return 0;
00756 }
00757 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_enc_pool_del_user);
00758 
00759 static inline void enc_pools_alloc(void)
00760 {
00761         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_max_pools);
00762         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(page_pools.epp_pools,
00763                         page_pools.epp_max_pools *
00764                         sizeof(*page_pools.epp_pools));
00765 }
00766 
00767 static inline void enc_pools_free(void)
00768 {
00769         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_max_pools);
00770         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools);
00771 
00772         OBD_FREE_LARGE(page_pools.epp_pools,
00773                        page_pools.epp_max_pools *
00774                        sizeof(*page_pools.epp_pools));
00775 }
00776 
00777 int sptlrpc_enc_pool_init(void)
00778 {
00779         DEF_SHRINKER_VAR(shvar, enc_pools_shrink,
00780                          enc_pools_shrink_count, enc_pools_shrink_scan);
00781 
00782         page_pools.epp_max_pages = totalram_pages / 8;
00783         if (enc_pool_max_memory_mb > 0 &&
00784             enc_pool_max_memory_mb <= (totalram_pages >> mult))
00785                 page_pools.epp_max_pages = enc_pool_max_memory_mb << mult;
00786 
00787         page_pools.epp_max_pools = npages_to_npools(page_pools.epp_max_pages);
00788 
00789         init_waitqueue_head(&page_pools.epp_waitq);
00790         page_pools.epp_waitqlen = 0;
00791         page_pools.epp_pages_short = 0;
00792 
00793         page_pools.epp_growing = 0;
00794 
00795         page_pools.epp_idle_idx = 0;
00796         page_pools.epp_last_shrink = cfs_time_current_sec();
00797         page_pools.epp_last_access = cfs_time_current_sec();
00798 
00799         spin_lock_init(&page_pools.epp_lock);
00800         page_pools.epp_total_pages = 0;
00801         page_pools.epp_free_pages = 0;
00802 
00803         page_pools.epp_st_max_pages = 0;
00804         page_pools.epp_st_grows = 0;
00805         page_pools.epp_st_grow_fails = 0;
00806         page_pools.epp_st_shrinks = 0;
00807         page_pools.epp_st_access = 0;
00808         page_pools.epp_st_missings = 0;
00809         page_pools.epp_st_lowfree = 0;
00810         page_pools.epp_st_max_wqlen = 0;
00811         page_pools.epp_st_max_wait = 0;
00812         page_pools.epp_st_outofmem = 0;
00813 
00814         enc_pools_alloc();
00815         if (page_pools.epp_pools == NULL)
00816                 return -ENOMEM;
00817 
00818         pools_shrinker = set_shrinker(pools_shrinker_seeks, &shvar);
00819         if (pools_shrinker == NULL) {
00820                 enc_pools_free();
00821                 return -ENOMEM;
00822         }
00823 
00824         return 0;
00825 }
00826 
00827 void sptlrpc_enc_pool_fini(void)
00828 {
00829         unsigned long cleaned, npools;
00830 
00831         LASSERT(pools_shrinker);
00832         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_pools);
00833         LASSERT(page_pools.epp_total_pages == page_pools.epp_free_pages);
00834 
00835         remove_shrinker(pools_shrinker);
00836 
00837         npools = npages_to_npools(page_pools.epp_total_pages);
00838         cleaned = enc_pools_cleanup(page_pools.epp_pools, npools);
00839         LASSERT(cleaned == page_pools.epp_total_pages);
00840 
00841         enc_pools_free();
00842 
00843         if (page_pools.epp_st_access > 0) {
00844                 CDEBUG(D_SEC,
00845                        "max pages %lu, grows %u, grow fails %u, shrinks %u, "
00846                        "access %lu, missing %lu, max qlen %u, max wait "
00847                        CFS_TIME_T"/%lu, out of mem %lu\n",
00848                        page_pools.epp_st_max_pages, page_pools.epp_st_grows,
00849                        page_pools.epp_st_grow_fails,
00850                        page_pools.epp_st_shrinks, page_pools.epp_st_access,
00851                        page_pools.epp_st_missings, page_pools.epp_st_max_wqlen,
00852                        page_pools.epp_st_max_wait,
00853                        msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC),
00854                        page_pools.epp_st_outofmem);
00855         }
00856 }
00857 
00858 
00859 static int cfs_hash_alg_id[] = {
00860         [BULK_HASH_ALG_NULL]    = CFS_HASH_ALG_NULL,
00861         [BULK_HASH_ALG_ADLER32] = CFS_HASH_ALG_ADLER32,
00862         [BULK_HASH_ALG_CRC32]   = CFS_HASH_ALG_CRC32,
00863         [BULK_HASH_ALG_MD5]     = CFS_HASH_ALG_MD5,
00864         [BULK_HASH_ALG_SHA1]    = CFS_HASH_ALG_SHA1,
00865         [BULK_HASH_ALG_SHA256]  = CFS_HASH_ALG_SHA256,
00866         [BULK_HASH_ALG_SHA384]  = CFS_HASH_ALG_SHA384,
00867         [BULK_HASH_ALG_SHA512]  = CFS_HASH_ALG_SHA512,
00868 };
00869 const char * sptlrpc_get_hash_name(__u8 hash_alg)
00870 {
00871         return cfs_crypto_hash_name(cfs_hash_alg_id[hash_alg]);
00872 }
00873 
00874 __u8 sptlrpc_get_hash_alg(const char *algname)
00875 {
00876         return cfs_crypto_hash_alg(algname);
00877 }
00878 
00879 int bulk_sec_desc_unpack(struct lustre_msg *msg, int offset, int swabbed)
00880 {
00881         struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc *bsd;
00882         int                          size = msg->lm_buflens[offset];
00883 
00884         bsd = lustre_msg_buf(msg, offset, sizeof(*bsd));
00885         if (bsd == NULL) {
00886                 CERROR("Invalid bulk sec desc: size %d\n", size);
00887                 return -EINVAL;
00888         }
00889 
00890         if (swabbed) {
00891                 __swab32s(&bsd->bsd_nob);
00892         }
00893 
00894         if (unlikely(bsd->bsd_version != 0)) {
00895                 CERROR("Unexpected version %u\n", bsd->bsd_version);
00896                 return -EPROTO;
00897         }
00898 
00899         if (unlikely(bsd->bsd_type >= SPTLRPC_BULK_MAX)) {
00900                 CERROR("Invalid type %u\n", bsd->bsd_type);
00901                 return -EPROTO;
00902         }
00903 
00904         /* FIXME more sanity check here */
00905 
00906         if (unlikely(bsd->bsd_svc != SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_NULL &&
00907                      bsd->bsd_svc != SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_INTG &&
00908                      bsd->bsd_svc != SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_PRIV)) {
00909                 CERROR("Invalid svc %u\n", bsd->bsd_svc);
00910                 return -EPROTO;
00911         }
00912 
00913         return 0;
00914 }
00915 EXPORT_SYMBOL(bulk_sec_desc_unpack);
00916 
00917 /*
00918  * Compute the checksum of an RPC buffer payload.  If the return \a buflen
00919  * is not large enough, truncate the result to fit so that it is possible
00920  * to use a hash function with a large hash space, but only use a part of
00921  * the resulting hash.
00922  */
00923 int sptlrpc_get_bulk_checksum(struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc, __u8 alg,
00924                               void *buf, int buflen)
00925 {
00926         struct cfs_crypto_hash_desc     *hdesc;
00927         int                             hashsize;
00928         unsigned int                    bufsize;
00929         int                             i, err;
00930 
00931         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
00932         LASSERT(alg > BULK_HASH_ALG_NULL && alg < BULK_HASH_ALG_MAX);
00933         LASSERT(buflen >= 4);
00934 
00935         hdesc = cfs_crypto_hash_init(cfs_hash_alg_id[alg], NULL, 0);
00936         if (IS_ERR(hdesc)) {
00937                 CERROR("Unable to initialize checksum hash %s\n",
00938                        cfs_crypto_hash_name(cfs_hash_alg_id[alg]));
00939                 return PTR_ERR(hdesc);
00940         }
00941 
00942         hashsize = cfs_crypto_hash_digestsize(cfs_hash_alg_id[alg]);
00943 
00944         for (i = 0; i < desc->bd_iov_count; i++) {
00945                 cfs_crypto_hash_update_page(hdesc,
00946                                   BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page,
00947                                   BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset &
00948                                               ~PAGE_MASK,
00949                                   BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len);
00950         }
00951 
00952         if (hashsize > buflen) {
00953                 unsigned char hashbuf[CFS_CRYPTO_HASH_DIGESTSIZE_MAX];
00954 
00955                 bufsize = sizeof(hashbuf);
00956                 LASSERTF(bufsize >= hashsize, "bufsize = %u < hashsize %u\n",
00957                          bufsize, hashsize);
00958                 err = cfs_crypto_hash_final(hdesc, hashbuf, &bufsize);
00959                 memcpy(buf, hashbuf, buflen);
00960         } else {
00961                 bufsize = buflen;
00962                 err = cfs_crypto_hash_final(hdesc, buf, &bufsize);
00963         }
00964 
00965         return err;
00966 }
